page.title: 01CROWBOROUGH AND ROTHERFIELD
page.content: Crowborough lying in the High Weald 800 feet above sea level was part of the ancient parish of Rotherfield until 1905 but with 16970 inhabitants is now the biggest town in Wealden Authority. It is the only Parish to have a full time Clerk. Twinning links with Montargis France have existed since May 1966 and strong ties of friendship were rewarded when winning the Sussex in Europe award in 1982. Rotherfield by acreage is the largest Parish in Wealden but has a population of 3090. It is mainly farmland and forestry land. Many small farms are amalgamating into larger concerns and boundaries disappearing. Arable farming predominates. Limekiln Wood occupies 32 hectares of conifers, grown for fencing, stakes and paper,replacing many great oaks. Rotherfield is a preserved area.
